definition[0]: power or the authority to influence other people’s decisions
example[0]: An official protest could carry considerable clout.
example[2]: Few companies have the clout to handle such large deals.
definition[1]: a hard blow given with the hand
example[3]: He gave him a clout round the ear.
definition[2]: to hit someone or something hard
example[4]: She clouted the boy across the face.
definition[3]: the power or authority to influence other people’s decisions
example[5]: AT&T and BT have sufficient market clout to win the support of wireless equipment manufacturers to help develop the technology.
